result.execSummary:
The defendant Blake Donald Field was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Blake Donald Field is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Blake Donald Field was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.
Defendant to report to Probation today November 16, 2015 by 4:00 p.m.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Court notes 145 days pre-sentence credit if revoked.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Court permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Agent.
-Complete all other Programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Blake Donald Field appeared. Case called at 2:17 p.m. Atty Harrelson recites the agreement. ADA Minser in agreement and requesting a PSI. Atty Harrelson states Dunn Co. DPA was revoked due to this case. Atty Harrelson argues the need for PSI. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 in 15CF75 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Possession of Methamphetamine in 15CF75. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct's 2 & 3 in 15CF75. Sentencing arguments. Court will not order a PSI. Crt orders:

- S/W 3 years probation. 145 days pre sentence credit if revoked. Defendant needs to report to probation by 4 p.m. Bond will continue until defendant reports. 

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-   Crt permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.

-  Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-    $268 court costs and $250 DNA Surcharge. To be paid over the course of probation

-    DNA Sample
Pre-trial conference at 11-16-2015 02:30 pm
Pre-trial conference at 11-10-2015 04:00 pm

CO: RMW, REP: Crandall, CLERK: Liddle. ADA: Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Blake Donald Field appeared. Case called at 10:17 a.m. Court reviews file. Hearing defenses motion on the search by the K9 and the qualifications of the K9. ADA Minser calls Deputy Johnson to the stand. S/T Justin Johnson. Direct by ADA Minser. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Witness excused. No further witnesses by either party. ADA Minser gives argument. Atty Harrelson will not give any argument citing case law. Court at this time will deny defenses motions. If case isn't settled by that date, court will set for trial. Bond continues  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
Evidentiary hearing at 09-22-2015 10:15 am

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Blake Donald Field appeared. Case called at 9:50 a.m. Court reviews file. Motion to Suppress was filed by the defense. Decision was issued by the court. Atty Harrelson makes argument. ADA Minser gives argument. Court states stop was prior to Rodriguez decision. Law enforcement was operating under Arias. Court will apply the good faith exception and will deny the defenses Motion to Suppress. Address updated. Bond continues.  Evidentiary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 10:15 am.

Preliminary hearing on March 4, 2015 at 09:30 am.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Shannon B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
